thanks alot ! i will be seeding! but im new to installing can you help me? i already put the files in a usb.

@kevin1724:
It depends on if you are doing a 'clean install', or an 'upgrade' ...
To Upgrade:
You must be logged into Windows to perform an Upgrade (NOTE: Even though files are not touched, it is still a good idea to back them all up, just in case) - Just insert the USB drive with the Windows install, and run the setup - When prompted, BE SURE to choose 'Upgrade', then continue install as normal.
Clean Install:
Once you have it on the USB, plug it in, and reboot - Once your BIOS screen loads, hit F8 (May differ on other PCs) to enter the Boot Device Selection screen - Select to boot from the USB, and continue - When prompted, select 'Clean Install', NOT 'Upgrade'!

I agree wich you, I hate people who download a torrent and then not seed, so I know this is offtopic but its valuable information for everyone.

How can i RE-SEED this after formating my pc??

Also dont ban my ip while i do this :p

@nightology_88:
The way I do it is I have a set folder on my Desktop for my torrents, and when I reformat I copy this to a different drive, so I can copy it back after - I also copy my %USER%AppDataRoaminguTorrent folder, so I'll have all my settings saved - If you do that, once you re-format, and re-installed uTorrent, copy the AppData copy to the AppData folder, and overwrite any files - When you start uTorrent, you should just have to 'Start', and will continue seeding (As long as you keep the files in the torrent download folder!)

@relentlesstech 

Ok, it's at router level...but then, my assumption still holds:

"it will be pretty useless as it will only mean the peer won't download from you..."


Of course the meaning of "useless" is arguable: if you ban hit-and-runners from downloading from you, that means you will slow them down a little bit ("only 1 seed stage") in the next torrent(s) they try to download from you...being you a seeder or a peer!

Ehehehe: but in these kind of things, I understand it will make you feel much better :)
"You do what you can"...

Anyway...it's a big thanks for you in the end: you do deserve all the pink in your skull, both for the content you upload, as well as for talking to your audience.

Thanks man: highly appreciated!

@nightology_88:
An ISO file needs to either be burned to a DVD/USB, or mounted in a virtual drive, such as with MagicISO - You cannot just 'run' an ISO file - Unpacking the ISO with WinRAR/WinZIP will extract the files, but will NOT allow it to be bootable - You need to use Nero to 'Burn Image to Disc' for DVD, or Google 'Windows USB DVD Download Tool' to be able to burn the ISO to a USB drive.

@relentlesstech
I have already mounted the ISO using WinIso on a HDD usb.
I burned the iso into 2 dvds using the windows default program and after with ImgBurn.

Then tried to boot each one of the methods I just described and it keeps loading my windows.
Im looking forward to find a solution, as it may be my pc, then I will post the results.

@nightology_88:
You split it between two DVDs?  Without the right config file on the DVD, it will never know to look for another disc ... I don't know if that may be the problem or not - Just trying to brainstorm LOL
Thanks for this, I'm downgrading my HTPC from W8 Pro to this :D I found W8 a bit buggy, would occasionally crash, and I didn't see any descent performance increase :D

@ nightology_88

Are you just restarting, and letting you system start up normally? You need to tell your system to boot from the CD first, rather than your normal HD or wherever your current OS is.

To do this you can either enter BIOS and change the boot order. Or, while your system is starting up (in POST) you can select the boot menu. It should tell you what key to press - it will be something like F12 or ESC, depending on your system. Then just select the drive, or CD, or USB that you're loading the .iso from.

The Loader is to activate Windows after install, if you install the non-OEM Windows - You can run Windows 7 with only 2GB of RAM, but it will be very slow - Windows 7 needs at least 4GB just to run stable (64-bit needs about 6GB minimum)

how much time period I can update Windows? And one more thing, after installing windows do I have to run any other program to make it activate? Please help I am kind of new.

@smoker05:
You will never be blocked from updating - As far as M$ is concerned, the OS is legit - Once you have installed Windows, you need to right-click the Loader, and 'Run as Admin' - Once it opens, click the 'Profile' tab in the Loader, and change the SLIC, Certificate, and Serial areas to whatever you want (As long as all 3 are the same!), then click the 'Installation' tab, and click 'Install' - Once finished, restart your computer, and you will be legit! :-)
